talk.author: did:plc:6srtggowwuy2bcsizlen7znr
talk.utter: For .gov domains like .gov.br, .gov.uk, etc, would be nice to have an automatic government badge next to the handle

talk.author: did:plc:rvifuhzna7ksttvsf65zheht
talk.utter: because it doesn't say ".gov" in the domain-handle enough or what?

talk.author: did:plc:6srtggowwuy2bcsizlen7znr
talk.utter: Because of UX. It's easier for people if something is demonstrated graphicaly. Social networks are also made for elders who often don't fully understand the concept of domain authority. A .gov website identification is very intrinsic, but a domain handle verification is something new

talk.author: did:plc:6srtggowwuy2bcsizlen7znr
talk.utter: Because of UX. It's easier for people if something is demonstrated graphicaly. Social networks are also made for elders who often don't fully understand the concept of domain authority. A .gov website identification is very intrinsic, but a domain handle verification is something new

talk.author: did:plc:g443xdn2atikf5ivqfgujpir
talk.utter: But users should really pay attention to WHICH .gov it is. There are hundreds of .govs

talk.author: did:plc:g443xdn2atikf5ivqfgujpir
talk.utter: I mean even within each country. Are they a senator or do they work at the dmv

talk.author: did:plc:6srtggowwuy2bcsizlen7znr
talk.utter: Why would DMV give a subdomain DNS register to an employee?

talk.author: did:plc:6srtggowwuy2bcsizlen7znr
talk.utter: Why would DMV give a subdomain DNS register to an employee?

talk.author: did:plc:g443xdn2atikf5ivqfgujpir
talk.utter: Because they control the dns and their boss didnt check

talk.author: did:plc:6srtggowwuy2bcsizlen7znr
talk.utter: I work for the Brazilian government. I canâ€™t even delete a SharePoint folder without authorization due to retention policies. DNS is CRITICAL access.
